channel.title: Education India, World, Top Education News - Times of India
channel.description: Get news and detailed information on careers & jobs, Indian and foreign schools, colleges & universities, campus & MBA news, online & distance education and higher education.

image.title: Education India, World, Top Education News - Times of India

item.title: China offers to start martial arts course under Mumbai University
item.description: China on Friday offered to start a programme in martial arts here through Mumbai University.

item.title: China offers to start martial arts course under Mumbai university
item.description: China on Friday offered to start a programme in martial arts here through Mumbai University.

item.title: IT professionals launch new education website
item.description: The software has the module to manage the hall of fame, notice board, library management and in the admin part.

item.title: CAT exams most popular but cumbersome, survey shows
item.description: The Common Admission Test (CAT) to the Indian Institutes of Management (IIM) remains the most popular choice for the bulk of MBA aspirants, even though they find such exams both cumbersome and expensive.

item.title: Maharashtra receives 430 madrassas' application for govt aid
item.description: As a part of 'Dr Zakir Hussain Madrassa Modernisation scheme,' the state government received 430 applications from madrassas for financial aid of Rs 2.5 lakh each.

item.title: President to inaugurate School of Commerce & Economics in Chennai
item.description: President Pranab Mukherjee will inaugurate the newly built School of Commerce and Economics Building at the Loyola College campus here later this week.

item.title: UGC regulations for approval of colleges offering tech education
item.description: UGC has come out with draft regulations for approval of colleges offering technical education in wake of a Supreme Court ruling earlier this year.

item.title: AIIMS to join hands with Michigan varsity for bio-medical research
item.description: All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS) is collaborating with the University of Michigan in the US to strengthen research capabilities in bio-medical sciences.

item.title: $3 million Melbourne-India scholarship launched
item.description: A new million-dollar scholarship will now provide researchers, innovators and entrepreneurs in Australia and India with top-notch guidance and academic support.

item.title: Southern states have 1/3rd of PhD enrolments
item.description: The three southern states of Andhra Pradesh, Tamil Nadu and Karnataka have a third of all PhD enrolments in the country while Delhi, home to 26 universities, comes fourth.

item.title: CBSE edutainment videos on Youtube have few takers
item.description: South Korean pop artist Psy’s ‘Gangnam Style’ music video on Youtube got 1.74 crore hits in a year. In contrast, the Central Board of Secondary Education’s Youtube videos have received lesser than 1,000 hits in the six months since they were posted.

item.title: President awards medals to IIT-Patna toppers
item.description: President Pranab Mukherjee on Saturday awarded medals to three toppers and degrees to dozens of students of IIT-Patna at its second convocation ceremony.

item.title: 6,346 write the CAT on Thursday
item.description: A total of 6,346 candidates wrote the Common Aptitude Test on Thursday, including 53 differently-abled ones.

item.title: Saarc countries likely to have common post-grad curriculum
item.description: Universities of all Saarc nations may share a common syllabus for five different curriculums in the next two years.

item.title: Cut-offs revised for IIT admissions
item.description: Only those students who are among the top 20 percentilers in the Intermediate Public Examination (IPE) while considering all the subjects would be eligible to take admission in the IITs in the country this year.

item.title: King's College London launches first Summer School in Delhi
item.description: One of Britain's leading universities, King's College London, has opened its first international Summer School in Delhi.

item.title: French lawmakers approve plan to introduce more courses in English at universities
item.description: France's lower house on Thursday approved a plan to introduce more courses in English at universities despite critics alleging it will undermine efforts to promote French.

item.title: Blind girl gets to class XII merit list, tops humanities group
item.description: Shristi Tiwari, a girl of many dreams and aspirations. This blind girl, who topped the Humanities Group with 481 marks and stood 4th in the overall provisional merit list of class XII MPBSE declared on Tuesday said she has "miles to go before she sleeps."

item.title: Norms for hiring teachers relaxed in 13 states
item.description: The central government Thursday gave its green signal to 13 states that had sought permission to relax the minimum qualification criteria for appointment of teachers under the Sarv Shiksha Abhiyan.

item.title: Norms for hiring teachers relaxed in 13 states
item.description: The central government Thursday gave its green signal to 13 states that had sought permission to relax the minimum qualification criteria for appointment of teachers under the Sarv Shiksha Abhiyan.

item.title: Short on faculty, IITs look towards students
item.description: Under-graduate engineering students from technical institutes may be able to teach and earn as they learn at the premier Indian Institutes of Technology.

item.title: Short on faculty, IITs look towards students
item.description: Under-graduate engineering students from technical institutes may be able to teach and earn as they learn at the premier Indian Institutes of Technology.

item.title: Country's education system burdened with demands of quantity, quality: President Pranab Mukherjee
item.description: President Pranab Mukherjee on Tuesday said despite achievements, it is widely recognized that our country's education system is burdened with demands of both quantity and quality.

item.title: Country's education system burdened with demands of quantity, quality: President Pranab Mukherjee
item.description: President Pranab Mukherjee on Tuesday said despite achievements, it is widely recognized that our country's education system is burdened with demands of both quantity and quality.

item.title: Inconsistent attendance policy troubles DU students
item.description: Delhi University students writing the semester exams are now subject to a hopelessly inconsistent attendance policy across colleges.
